channel.title: WorldScape Blitz - 2000 Players on one server w/ no lag
channel.description:
[center][img]http://www.allgofree.org/logos/community/voltimolt_logo_trans_scaled_80.gif[/img] [size=14pt][b]This is the most powerful RuneScape private server. [u]Ever[/u].[/b][/size]
[size=18pt][b]You can check out an awesome video of this here: Part 1: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzXz6hvfhc4]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzXz6hvfhc4[/url] Update: Part 2, w/ chatting/walking: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GRhHGFAR5so]YouTube - 2k Players Part 2[/url] [/b][/size]
[/center]
Many of you know that today's private servers aren't capable of holding that many players, and can easily be crashed by bots that connect massive amount of players to them, like so: [center][img]http://www.allgofree.org/pics/bot.jpg[/img][/center]
You also probably know that the real RuneScape worlds can each hold 2k (2000) players each. I think that makes 2000 players an excellent goal amount for private servers, [b]and a great test to see how powerful a server really is[/b].
Hyperion was the second server to achieve this goal, the first being Frugooscape, but the CPU usage of the server was getting extremely close to 100% (with multithreading), and the bots were doing nothing but standing. The bots were also distributed around the world to lessen the server load.
Now, [b]my Blitz Server is the third server to ever do this[/b], but I have put [b]all 2,000 of the bots into the Castle Wars arena[/b], and we've done it with [b]less then 40% CPU usage[/b] on the Core handling the player code thread. Hyperion employes multiple task threads, while I employ one for player updating, and the other cores are used for IO.
[center][b]2000 players in one general area on one server with no lag[/b] [img]http://www.allgofree.org/blitz/pics/players2.png[/img]
[b]Same server with a 508 client[/b] [img]http://www.allgofree.org/blitz/pics/players1.png[/img] [/center]
Even with the 2,000 bots connected to it, each server tick still took [b]only 100 milliseconds [/b]to complete, leaving the server completely [b]lag-free[/b].
[center]Here is proof that this was NOT done with localhost: [img]http://www.allgofree.org/blitz/pics/bots_teamview1.png[/img]
[center][size=18pt][b]You can check out an awesome video of this here: Part 1: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzXz6hvfhc4]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzXz6hvfhc4[/url] Update: Part 2, w/ chatting/walking: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GRhHGFAR5so]YouTube - 2k Players Part 2[/url] [/b][/size]
[size=14pt][b]This is the most powerful RuneScape private server. [u]Ever[/u].[/b][/size] [/center]

item.title: WorldScape Blitz - 2000 Players on one server w/ no lag
item.dc:creator: @Yorchi_elite Yorchi elite
item.description:
@Yorchi_elite wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:1, topic:346677”][center]
[size=14pt]This is the most powerful RuneScape private server. Ever.[/size]

[size=18pt]You can check out an awesome video of this here:
Part 1: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzXz6hvfhc4
Update: Part 2, w/ chatting/walking: YouTube - 2k Players Part 2
[/size]

[/center]

Many of you know that today’s private servers aren’t capable of holding that many players, and can easily be crashed by bots that connect massive amount of players to them, like so:
[center]

bot.jpg1033×510
[/center]

You also probably know that the real RuneScape worlds can each hold 2k (2000) players each. I think that makes 2000 players an excellent goal amount for private servers, and a great test to see how powerful a server really is.

Hyperion was the second server to achieve this goal, the first being Frugooscape, but the CPU usage of the server was getting extremely close to 100% (with multithreading), and the bots were doing nothing but standing. The bots were also distributed around the world to lessen the server load.

Now, my Blitz Server is the third server to ever do this, but I have put all 2,000 of the bots into the Castle Wars arena, and we’ve done it with less then 40% CPU usage on the Core handling the player code thread. Hyperion employes multiple task threads, while I employ one for player updating, and the other cores are used for IO.

[center]2000 players in one general area on one server with no lag

players2.png775×536

Same server with a 508 client

players1.png780×544

[/center]

Even with the 2,000 bots connected to it, each server tick still took only 100 milliseconds to complete, leaving the server completely lag-free.

[center]Here is proof that this was NOT done with localhost:

bots_teamview1.png809×561

[center][size=18pt]You can check out an awesome video of this here:
Part 1: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IzXz6hvfhc4
Update: Part 2, w/ chatting/walking: YouTube - 2k Players Part 2
[/size]

[size=14pt]This is the most powerful RuneScape private server. Ever.[/size]
[/center][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: WorldScape Blitz - 2000 Players on one server w/ no lag
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Graham:

Not exactly. Hyperion breaks out of the loop once it doesn’t have enough room in the local list, so in reality it is doing 2000 x 255 iterations (255 for the players the client can see, then it won’t enter the second loop which adds new players as the player list size is 255).

Oh, then good.

Read full topic

item.title: WorldScape Blitz - 2000 Players on one server w/ no lag
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:41, topic:346677”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=443056.msg3258048#msg3258048 date=1278279366]
putting 2000 people in one area means nothing because you can only see 255 at a time. also, those players arent even doing anything. i’m not impressed.
[/quote]
Seeing only 255 at a time is completely irrelevant. If you looked in the player updating code in lets say, Hyperion, it iterates through every single player in the region(s) near the player it is updating, which means that there would be 2000 players all looping through the 2000 players, because they are all in the same general area. The 255 limit only effects the building of the packet sent to the client. :rolleyes:[/quote]
[/quote]

Not exactly. Hyperion breaks out of the loop once it doesn’t have enough room in the local list, so in reality it is doing 2000 x 255 iterations (255 for the players the client can see, then it won’t enter the second loop which adds new players as the player list size is 255).

Read full topic

item.title: WorldScape Blitz - 2000 Players on one server w/ no lag
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Davidi2:

It’s amazing you have multi-version support, but you can’t really use the 508 only cache things or wont it crash the 317 clients?

He made it so any npcs spawned around the game that are above the 317 version change into “Hans” if you’re on the 317 client. With the items and all that, he’s either going to make them not show up at all or he’s going to change them into a different item if you’re on a lower version client that doesn’t support it.

Read full topic
